intro: Cephaelis peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian flame flower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptic, and have a glossy texture. Cephaelis peruviana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
